_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
February 11th, 2:30 PM
Good afternoon riders and skiers-It's a powder day with free refills included! Mother nature delivered 5-6 inches of dense snow overnight helping to reset our already stellar conditions! The forecast calls for cloudy skies and snow showers expected to linger into the evening, already accumulating another 2 inches since opening bell bringing our storm total to 8 inches.  Temperatures will be warming up into the upper teens to low 20s at the summit, and upper 20s to low 30's at the base. Well be getting down on 465 skiable acres, served by 13 lifts, with 56 of 109 trails groomed, including fan favorites like Jester, Ripcord, and Elbow. Look forward to powder and packed powder conditions across the mountain today.

Operations are in regular weekday hours. GMX will get the party started, loading at 8:00 AM. All other scheduled lifts open at 9:00 AM. With the exception of Slide Brook which will be opening at 10:00 AM. The legendary Sugarbush Parks crew has you covered for all your freestyle fun. At Mt. Ellen, youll find over 94 features on Riemergasse and another 28 on Sugar Run, all serviced by the iconic Sunny Quad. At Lincoln Peak, Slowpoke now has 18 refreshed features, and 7 playful features remain in Sugarbear Forest. Inverness and Brambles will be closed to the public for race training events. Tomorrow, Racer's Edge will be reserved for racing and then open to the public at noon.

Join us Feb. 12th at Rumbles Bistro & Bar for the Olympic Halfpipe Finals! Were showing all the action on our massive TV wall, so you wont miss it. Our friends at POW will be here to host the watch party and support POW athletes Chloe Kim and Bea Kim. Things get started at 1:30PM, so get here early to grab your seat and get ready to cheer on Team USA! Check out all our winter events.

All Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen uphill routes are currently open.  Please review our Uphill Travel Policy for full details.
